posts.title: La Orca
posts.excerpt: A teenage girl is kidnapped by 3 guys and taken to an abandoned house in the country, and make her write her own ransom letter. She soon discovers that one of her captors is infatuated with her and she will use those feelings to stay alive.

posts.title: Suddilage Kathawa
posts.excerpt: A masterpiece of Sri Lankan cinema, “Suddilage Kathawa” or “A Woman in a Whirlpool” is the third film by Dharmasiri Bandaranayake. Swarna Mallawarachi plays the role of Suddi who is married to Romiel, a hired assassin played by Cyril Wickramage. Suddi’s life becomes complex when her husband ends up in prison and she is forced …

posts._title: Gustaf Edgren – Valborgsmassoafton AKA Walpurgis Night (1935)
posts.title: Valborgsmassoafton
posts.excerpt: Synopsis: ‘Lena Bergstrom works in an office and is unhappily in love with her boss, Johan Borg. She decides to quit. Borg’s wife won’t have any children, and when she becomes pregnant she has an illegal abortion. For some reason, Lena’s father believes that it is Lena who has had an abortion.’ – Mattias Thuresson …

posts._title: Jean-Pierre Limosin – Abbas Kiarostami – Verités et songes (1994)
posts.title: Abbas Kiarostami – Verités et songes
posts.excerpt: Description: This documentary by French director Jean-Pierre Limosin is the first Spanish edition of the renowned “Cinéma, de notre temps” series. In this episode, Abbas Kiarostami talks about his life and work. Summarising his approach to filmaking, Kiarostami said: “A filmmaker has to be conscious about his responsibility. I always wish to remind the audience …

posts.title: The Cheat
posts.excerpt: Description: One of the early De Mille’s melodramas: love triangle, fruvolous wife, demonic Japanese tempter… But besides all that melodramatic rubbish it’s one of the most innovative films of the era. De Mille actively experimented with lighting, cutting, and framing to extend narrative technique. “The Cheat” featured probably the first use of so called “psychological …
